fields.question: What's your minimum order quantity?
fields.answer: Our minimum order quantity is 10,000 pieces. This allows us to offer competitive pricing while maintaining the high quality standards our customers expect. Bulk ordering also provides the best value per unit and ensures you have adequate inventory for your business needs.

fields.question: Do you ship across Canada?
fields.answer: Yes! We provide shipping services across all of Canada. Whether you're in Toronto, Vancouver, Montreal, Calgary, or any other city, we can deliver your custom paper bags to your location. Shipping costs and delivery times vary by destination and order size. Contact us for a detailed shipping quote for your specific location.

fields.question: How long does custom printing take?
fields.answer:
Custom printing typically takes 10-12 business days from the time your artwork is approved and your order is confirmed. This timeline includes:

  • Artwork review and approval (1-2 days)
  • Production and printing (7-9 days)
  • Quality control and packaging (1 day)

Rush orders may be available for an additional fee. Please contact us to discuss expedited options if you have a tight deadline.

fields.question: What paper GSM should I choose?
fields.answer:
The right GSM (grams per square meter) depends on your intended use:

  • 60-80 GSM: Lightweight and economical. Best for light items like clothing, gift wrapping, and promotional events. Can hold up to 2 kg comfortably.
  • 90-100 GSM: Our most popular option. Balances durability and cost. Suitable for most retail applications and can hold 5-8 kg.
  • 120+ GSM: Premium, heavy-duty bags with excellent strength. Ideal for heavier items, luxury retail, and customers who want a premium feel. Can hold 10+ kg.

We're happy to provide samples so you can test different GSM options with your actual products before placing a bulk order.

fields.question: Are your bags biodegradable?
fields.answer:
Yes! All our paper bags are 100% biodegradable and environmentally friendly. Made from kraft paper, they naturally decompose within 2-6 weeks when exposed to the elements, unlike plastic bags which can take hundreds of years.

Our bags are also:

  • Recyclable: Can be recycled 5-7 times through standard paper recycling programs
  • Compostable: Safe for composting facilities
  • Sustainable: Made from renewable resources with FSC certification options available
  • Chemical-free: No harmful additives or coatings

By choosing our paper bags, you're making an environmentally responsible choice that aligns with Canada's plastic reduction initiatives.

fields.question: Can I see samples before ordering?
fields.answer:
Absolutely! We encourage customers to request samples before placing large orders. We can provide:

  • Blank samples: Unprinted bags in various sizes and GSM weights (free)
  • Printed samples: Previous work examples to show print quality
  • Custom sample run: A small batch with your design (additional cost)

Contact us to request samples, and we'll ship them to you so you can evaluate quality, size, and weight capacity with your actual products.

fields.question: What customization options are available?
fields.answer:
We offer extensive customization options:

Sizes: 13 standard sizes from 5" to 18" width, or custom dimensions

Printing:

  • 1-4 color flexographic printing
  • Full-color digital printing
  • Hot stamping and foil printing
  • Inside and outside printing

Handle Options:

  • Twisted paper handles (standard)
  • Flat paper handles (reinforced)
  • Cotton rope handles (premium)
  • Ribbon handles (luxury)

Paper Options: Natural kraft, white kraft, colored paper, recycled content

Finishes: Matte, gloss, or textured finishes available

fields.question: What file format do you need for artwork?
fields.answer:
For best printing results, please provide:

  • Vector files: AI, EPS, or PDF (preferred)
  • Raster files: High-resolution PNG or JPG (300 DPI minimum)
  • Color mode: CMYK (not RGB)
  • Bleed: Include 3mm bleed on all edges
  • Fonts: Convert all text to outlines/curves

Don't have print-ready artwork? No problem! Our design team can help optimize your files or create designs from scratch. We provide free design consultation and digital proofs before production.

fields.question: Do you offer rush production?
fields.answer:
Yes, rush production is available depending on our current production schedule and order complexity. Rush orders typically add 3-5 business days to standard production, but we can accommodate faster turnarounds when possible.

Rush production incurs an additional fee based on order size and timeline requirements. Contact us as soon as possible with your deadline, and we'll do our best to accommodate your needs.

For the fastest service, consider:

  • Using standard sizes (eliminates custom die-cutting)
  • Limiting colors (1-2 colors print faster than full color)
  • Having print-ready artwork approved quickly

fields.question: What payment methods do you accept?
fields.answer:
We accept multiple payment methods for your convenience:

  • Bank Transfer/Wire Transfer: For large orders (preferred)
  • Credit Cards: Visa, Mastercard, American Express
  • Company Check: For established business accounts
  • Payment Terms: Net 30 available for approved accounts

A 50% deposit is typically required before production begins, with the balance due before shipping. We can discuss alternative payment arrangements for large or recurring orders.

fields.title: Why Choose Paper Bags Over Plastic? Environmental Benefits Explained
fields.excerpt: Discover the environmental advantages of switching from plastic to paper bags for your business. Learn about biodegradability, recyclability, and carbon footprint reduction.
fields.content:
The Environmental Crisis of Plastic Bags

Every year, Canadians use billions of plastic bags, with most ending up in landfills or polluting our oceans. Unlike paper bags, plastic bags can take up to 1,000 years to decompose, releasing harmful microplastics into our environment throughout their breakdown process.

Key Environmental Benefits of Paper Bags

1. Biodegradability

Paper bags decompose naturally within 2-6 weeks when exposed to the elements, compared to centuries for plastic bags. This rapid biodegradation significantly reduces long-term environmental impact and landfill waste.

2. Recyclability

Paper bags have an impressive recycling rate. In Canada, paper recycling infrastructure is well-established, and paper bags can be recycled 5-7 times before the fibers break down. This circular economy approach minimizes raw material consumption.

3. Renewable Resource

Paper comes from trees, a renewable resource when managed through sustainable forestry practices. Many paper bag manufacturers now use FSC-certified paper, ensuring responsible forest management.

4. Lower Carbon Footprint

While paper bag production requires energy, modern manufacturing processes have become increasingly efficient. When considering the entire lifecycle including disposal, paper bags have a lower carbon footprint than plastic bags.

Business Benefits Beyond Environmental Impact

Brand Image Enhancement

Consumers increasingly prefer businesses that demonstrate environmental responsibility. Using paper bags signals your commitment to sustainability, improving brand perception and customer loyalty.

Customization Opportunities

Paper bags offer superior printing quality compared to plastic, allowing for vibrant, high-quality brand designs. This transforms your packaging into a marketing tool that customers actually want to reuse.

Regulatory Compliance

Many Canadian cities have implemented or are considering plastic bag bans. Switching to paper bags now ensures your business stays ahead of regulatory changes.

Common Myths About Paper Bags

Myth: Paper Bags Are Less Durable

Modern paper bags use reinforced handles and high-GSM (grams per square meter) paper that can carry substantial weight. Our 100 GSM bags can hold 5-10 kg comfortably.

Myth: Paper Bags Cost More

While individual unit costs may be slightly higher, the marketing value and customer perception benefits often offset the difference. Bulk ordering also significantly reduces per-unit costs.

Making the Switch

Transitioning to paper bags is straightforward. At PackAxis, we offer various sizes and customization options to match your business needs. Our team can help you select the right bag specifications for your products while maintaining cost-effectiveness.

Ready to make the sustainable switch? Contact us today for a free consultation and discover how paper bags can enhance both your environmental impact and brand image.
fields.meta_description: Learn why paper bags are the eco-friendly choice for Canadian businesses. Explore environmental benefits, sustainability facts, and cost-effective packaging solutions.
fields.meta_keywords: paper bags environmental benefits, sustainable packaging, plastic vs paper bags, eco-friendly shopping bags, biodegradable bags Canada
fields.author: PackAxis Team

fields.title: Custom Paper Bag Printing Guide: Tips for Eye-Catching Designs
fields.excerpt: Learn professional tips for designing custom printed paper bags that grab attention and promote your brand. From color selection to logo placement strategies.
fields.content:
Why Custom Printed Paper Bags Matter

Your paper bag is more than packaging‚Äîit's a mobile advertisement. Every customer who carries your branded bag becomes a walking billboard, exposing your brand to hundreds of potential customers.

Design Fundamentals for Paper Bags

1. Keep It Simple

The most effective designs follow the "less is more" principle. A clean logo with one or two brand colors creates higher impact than cluttered designs. Your bag will be seen from various distances, so simplicity ensures recognition.

2. Logo Placement Strategy

Strategic placement maximizes visibility:

  • Front Center: Primary visibility when carried by hand
  • Both Sides: Ensures visibility from any angle
  • Bottom Gusset: Additional branding opportunity
  • Inside Print: Creates a premium unboxing experience

3. Color Psychology in Packaging

Colors evoke emotions and influence purchasing decisions:

  • Blue: Trust, professionalism (banks, tech companies)
  • Green: Eco-friendly, health (organic stores, wellness brands)
  • Red: Energy, urgency (food, sales promotions)
  • Black: Luxury, sophistication (fashion, premium goods)
  • Earth Tones: Natural, sustainable (artisan brands, cafes)

Technical Considerations

Printing Methods

Flexographic Printing

Best for large runs (5,000+ units). Cost-effective with good quality. Ideal for logos and simple designs with 1-3 colors.

Digital Printing

Perfect for smaller quantities or complex, full-color designs. No setup costs make it economical for orders under 5,000 units.

Hot Stamping/Foil Printing

Creates premium metallic effects. Excellent for luxury brands wanting to stand out. Works beautifully on dark paper stocks.

Paper Stock Selection

Paper quality affects print results:

  • 60-80 GSM: Lightweight, economical. Best for light items, promotional events
  • 90-100 GSM: Standard retail weight. Balances durability and cost
  • 120+ GSM: Premium feel, excellent print quality. Ideal for luxury retail

Design Best Practices

Typography Tips

  • Use fonts larger than 12pt for readability
  • Limit to 2-3 font families maximum
  • Ensure high contrast between text and background
  • Avoid overly decorative fonts for business names

File Preparation

For best printing results:

  • Provide vector files (AI, EPS, or PDF) when possible
  • Use CMYK color mode, not RGB
  • Include 3mm bleed on all edges
  • Minimum 300 DPI for raster images
  • Convert all text to outlines/curves

Cost Optimization Strategies

Reduce Colors

Each additional color increases setup costs. A well-designed 1-2 color print can be just as effective as full color while significantly reducing per-unit costs.

Standard Sizes

Using standard bag sizes eliminates custom die-cutting fees. We offer 13 standard sizes suitable for 90% of retail applications.

Bulk Ordering

Per-unit costs decrease dramatically with volume. Consider ordering a 6-12 month supply if you have storage capacity.

Common Design Mistakes to Avoid

  • Placing important elements too close to edges (allow 5mm safe zone)
  • Using low-resolution images that pixelate when printed
  • Choosing colors that don't work on kraft paper
  • Overcrowding the design with too much information
  • Forgetting to proof the actual bag size, not just the flat design

Get Professional Support

At PackAxis, our design team can help optimize your artwork for printing. We offer free design consultation and proofs before production, ensuring your bags turn out exactly as envisioned.

Ready to create stunning custom bags? Upload your design or schedule a consultation with our team today.

fields.meta_keywords: custom paper bag printing, printed shopping bags, logo design bags, brand packaging, custom packaging design Canada

fields.title: How to Choose the Right Paper Bag Size for Your Products
fields.excerpt: Complete guide to selecting optimal paper bag dimensions for different products. Learn about bag sizes, weight capacity, and cost-effective packaging choices.
fields.content:
Why Bag Size Matters

Choosing the correct bag size is crucial for three reasons: cost efficiency, customer experience, and brand perception. An oversized bag wastes money and materials, while an undersized bag frustrates customers and risks product damage.

Understanding Paper Bag Measurements

Three Key Dimensions

Paper bags are measured in:

  • Width: Opening width at the top
  • Height: Total bag height including any fold-over
  • Gusset (Depth): Bottom depth that expands to accommodate items

For example, a "10 x 13 x 5" bag means 10" wide, 13" tall, and 5" deep when fully expanded.

Standard Paper Bag Sizes Guide

Small Bags (5-8" width)

Best for: Jewelry, cosmetics, accessories, small gift items

Common sizes:

  • 5 No: 5" x 7" x 3" - Perfect for rings, small jewelry boxes
  • 7 No: 7" x 9" x 4" - Ideal for makeup products, small accessories

Medium Bags (8-12" width)

Best for: Clothing items, books, gift sets, takeout containers

Common sizes:

  • 10 No: 10" x 13" x 5" - Standard retail shopping bag
  • 12 No: 12" x 15" x 5.5" - Comfortable for folded clothing, multiple items

Large Bags (12-18" width)

Best for: Bulky items, multiple purchases, large gifts

Common sizes:

  • 14 No: 14" x 17" x 6" - Popular for apparel stores, gift shops
  • 16 No: 16" x 19" x 6" - Large shopping trips, wholesale items
  • 18 No: 18" x 20" x 7" - Maximum size for heavy-duty shopping

Industry-Specific Sizing Recommendations

Fashion Retail

Most clothing stores need 2-3 sizes:

  • Small (7-8"): Accessories, undergarments
  • Medium (10-12"): Single item purchases
  • Large (14-16"): Multiple items or coats/jackets

Restaurants & Bakeries

  • 7-8": Individual pastries, sandwiches
  • 10": Standard takeout meals
  • 12": Family-size orders, pizza boxes

Gift Shops

  • 8-10": Most gift items, decorative pieces
  • 12-14": Larger gifts, multiple items

Pharmacies & Health Stores

  • 7-8": Prescriptions, supplement bottles
  • 10": Standard shopping trips

Weight Capacity Considerations

GSM (Paper Weight) vs. Load Capacity

Paper thickness (GSM - grams per square meter) determines weight capacity:

  • 60-70 GSM: Up to 2 kg - Light items, gift wrapping
  • 80-90 GSM: Up to 5 kg - Standard retail use
  • 100-120 GSM: Up to 10 kg - Heavy items, canned goods

Handle Strength

Handle type affects carrying capacity:

  • Twisted paper handles: 3-5 kg comfortably
  • Flat paper handles: 5-8 kg with reinforcement
  • Cotton/ribbon handles: 8-12 kg, premium feel

Cost Optimization Tips

1. Standardize Your Sizes

Instead of ordering 5 different sizes, choose 2-3 that cover 90% of your needs. This increases volume per size, reducing per-unit costs.

2. Right-Size, Don't Oversize

While generous packaging seems customer-friendly, you pay for every inch of material. A properly fitted bag provides better product protection than excessive space.

3. Consider Multi-Use Bags

A 12" bag can accommodate many of the same items as both a 10" and 14" bag. Strategic sizing can eliminate middle options.

Measuring Your Products

Step-by-Step Sizing Process

  1. Measure your most common products (include packaging)
  2. Add 1-2" to width and height for comfortable fit
  3. Choose gusset depth based on product thickness
  4. Test with sample bags before bulk ordering
  5. Request samples from your supplier (we provide free samples!)

Pro Tip: The "Loose Fit" Rule

Products should fit comfortably with minimal forcing. Bags that are too tight:

  • Risk tearing during loading
  • Create poor customer experience
  • Can damage products
  • Make handles uncomfortable to carry

Special Considerations

Seasonal Variations

Winter coats and bulky items may require larger bags than summer clothing. Consider seasonal size inventory if you have storage capacity.

Multiple Items

If customers frequently purchase multiple items, size up one level to accommodate bundled purchases comfortably.

Brand Perception

Luxury brands often choose slightly oversized bags for a premium feel, while value retailers optimize for efficiency.

Sample Before You Order

At PackAxis, we always recommend ordering samples before committing to large quantities. We provide free samples of our standard sizes so you can physically test fit with your products.

Need help choosing? Contact our team for a free sizing consultation. We'll review your products and recommend the most cost-effective bag sizes for your business.

fields.title: Canada's Plastic Ban: What It Means for Your Business in 2025
fields.excerpt: Understanding Canada's single-use plastic regulations and how they impact retailers. Learn compliance requirements and transition strategies for sustainable packaging.
fields.content:
Overview of Canada's Plastic Regulations

In December 2022, Canada began phasing in bans on several single-use plastics as part of the Single-use Plastics Prohibition Regulations. This landmark environmental policy continues to affect retailers across the country throughout 2025.

What's Banned and When

Current Prohibitions (As of December 2024)

  • Manufacture and import ban: Fully in effect for checkout bags, cutlery, foodservice ware, stir sticks, and straws (with exceptions)
  • Sale ban: Active for all the above items
  • Export ban: Implemented to prevent dumping banned items internationally

Checkout Bag Specifics

The regulations specifically target conventional plastic checkout bags that are:

  • Less than 50 microns thick
  • Made of plastic without recycled content requirements
  • Provided at point of sale for carrying purchased goods

Provincial and Municipal Variations

Additional Local Bans

Many Canadian cities have implemented stricter regulations than federal requirements:

British Columbia

Vancouver, Victoria, and other municipalities have banned all plastic bags, including thicker variants. Some cities require minimum fees for paper bags.

Ontario

Toronto encourages reusable bags through fee structures. Several GTA municipalities have complete plastic bag bans.

Quebec

Montreal implemented one of Canada's first plastic bag bans. Provincial discussions ongoing about province-wide restrictions.

Exemptions and Exceptions

Medical and Health Products

Plastic packaging for prescription medications, medical devices, and health products remains exempt to ensure safety and sterility.

Primary Product Packaging

Plastic packaging that's part of a product's original sealed packaging (before retail sale) is not covered by checkout bag bans.

Specialty Applications

Certain industries have temporary exemptions while developing alternatives:

  • Pet waste bags (though compostable alternatives encouraged)
  • Bags for bulk foods and produce (being phased out gradually)
  • Garbage and recycling bags (household use)

Impact on Different Business Types

Retail Stores

What you need to do:

  • Transition completely to paper bags, reusable bags, or other compliant alternatives
  • Update supplier contracts to ensure compliance
  • Train staff on regulations and customer communication
  • Consider implementing bag fee programs

Restaurants and Food Service

Requirements:

  • Replace plastic takeout bags with paper alternatives
  • Switch to compliant food containers and cutlery
  • Communicate changes to delivery platforms

E-commerce and Delivery

Considerations:

  • Shipping packaging has different rules than checkout bags
  • Focus on recyclable, compostable alternatives
  • Communicate sustainability efforts in marketing

Compliance and Enforcement

Penalties for Non-Compliance

Violations can result in:

  • Fines up to $500,000 for corporations
  • Criminal charges for serious or repeated violations
  • Reputational damage and customer backlash

Verification Requirements

Retailers must:

  • Maintain records of bag suppliers and compliance certifications
  • Be able to demonstrate bag materials meet regulations
  • Ensure imported bags comply with Canadian standards

Transitioning Your Business

Step 1: Audit Current Packaging

Review all plastic items you currently use:

  • Checkout bags (all sizes)
  • Product packaging
  • Food service items if applicable
  • Promotional materials

Step 2: Source Compliant Alternatives

Consider these paper bag options:

  • Kraft paper bags: Economical, recyclable, various strengths
  • Recycled content bags: Enhanced sustainability credentials
  • Custom printed bags: Maintain brand visibility
  • Premium bags: Upscale retail experience

Step 3: Calculate Costs and Pricing

Paper bags cost more than plastic, but:

  • Bulk ordering significantly reduces per-unit costs
  • Many customers accept small bag fees
  • Marketing value offsets some cost difference
  • Regulatory compliance avoids penalties

Step 4: Customer Communication

Transparency builds goodwill:

  • Explain the regulatory reason for changes
  • Highlight environmental benefits
  • Promote your sustainability commitment
  • Encourage customers to bring reusable bags

Business Advantages of Early Transition

Marketing Opportunities

Being ahead of regulations positions you as an environmental leader. Use this in marketing materials and social media.

Customer Loyalty

Studies show consumers increasingly prefer environmentally responsible businesses. 73% of Canadian consumers consider sustainability in purchase decisions.

Risk Mitigation

Early transition prevents last-minute scrambling, supply chain issues, and potential non-compliance during rushed changeovers.

Looking Ahead: Future Regulations

Potential Expansions

Watch for upcoming regulations on:

  • Expanded packaging requirements
  • Extended producer responsibility programs
  • Circular economy initiatives
  • Compostability standards

Get Compliant Today

At PackAxis, we specialize in helping Canadian businesses navigate plastic bag regulations. We offer:

  • Compliant paper bag solutions in all sizes
  • Free consultation on regulatory requirements
  • Bulk pricing for cost-effective transitions
  • Custom printing for brand continuity
  • Fast Canada-wide delivery

Don't wait until the last minute. Contact us today for a free compliance consultation and quote. We'll help you transition smoothly while staying within budget.

fields.title: Paper Bags Wholesale Canada: Complete Guide for Toronto Restaurants & Retailers 2025
fields.excerpt: Complete guide to sourcing paper bags wholesale Canada, custom paper bags Toronto, and eco-friendly packaging. Learn about kraft paper bags bulk pricing, customization options, and why Canadian restaurants and retailers choose recyclable paper bags.
fields.content:
Looking for paper bags wholesale Canada or custom paper bags Toronto? This comprehensive guide covers everything Canadian restaurants and retailers need to know about sourcing eco-friendly packaging Canada, including wholesale pricing, customization options, and sustainability benefits.

Why Canadian Businesses Choose Paper Bags Wholesale

The shift to recyclable paper bags isn't just a trend‚Äîit's a business necessity. With Canada's single-use plastics ban fully implemented in 2025, restaurants, retailers, and food service businesses across Toronto and nationwide need reliable suppliers of sustainable packaging solutions.

Ordering kraft paper bags bulk offers several advantages:

  • Cost Savings: Wholesale pricing reduces per-unit costs significantly
  • Brand Consistency: Large orders ensure uniform quality across all locations
  • Environmental Compliance: Meet federal plastic ban regulations
  • Customer Preference: 78% of Canadian consumers prefer eco-friendly packaging
  • Marketing Value: Custom branded shopping bags increase brand visibility

Custom Paper Bags Toronto: Branding Options

As a restaurant paper bags supplier serving Toronto and all of Canada, we offer extensive customization for branded shopping bags:

Printing Options

  • Flexographic Printing: Cost-effective for large volume orders (10,000+ units)
  • Digital Printing: Perfect for smaller runs with complex designs
  • Hot Stamping: Premium metallic finishes for luxury brands
  • Custom Colors: Match your exact brand Pantone colors

Popular Customization Choices

  • Logo placement on both sides
  • Full-color restaurant menus or product information
  • QR codes linking to digital menus or loyalty programs
  • Seasonal designs and promotional messages
  • Social media handles and contact information

Kraft Paper Bags Bulk: Types and Specifications

Understanding paper bag specifications helps you choose the right eco-friendly packaging Canada solution:

Paper Types

  • Brown Kraft Paper (70-120 GSM): Natural, rustic look for organic/artisan brands
  • White Kraft Paper (80-150 GSM): Clean, professional appearance for retail
  • Colored Kraft Paper (90-120 GSM): Stand out with vibrant custom colors
  • Recycled Paper (80-100 GSM): Maximum sustainability credentials

Handle Options

  • Twisted Paper Handles: Durable and comfortable for heavier items
  • Flat Paper Handles: Economic choice for lighter products
  • Die-Cut Handles: Integrated design without additional materials
  • Rope Handles: Premium look for boutique retailers

Common Sizes for Canadian Businesses

  • Small (8" x 4.75" x 10"): Boutiques, pharmacies, small purchases
  • Medium (10" x 5" x 13"): Clothing stores, restaurants, general retail
  • Large (12" x 6" x 16"): Grocery stores, bulk purchases, takeout orders
  • Extra Large (16" x 6" x 19"): Catering, large orders, department stores

Restaurant Paper Bags Supplier: Food Service Specifications

Restaurants and food service businesses have unique requirements for recyclable paper bags:

Food-Safe Requirements

  • FDA-approved materials for direct food contact
  • Grease-resistant coatings for hot or oily foods
  • Strong construction to handle takeout containers
  • Reinforced bottoms for stability
  • Moisture-resistant options for beverages

Popular Restaurant Applications

  • Quick Service Restaurants: Burger bags, sandwich bags, combo meal bags
  • Fine Dining Takeout: Premium branded bags with rope handles
  • Bakeries & Cafes: Pastry bags, coffee carrier bags
  • Grocery Delivery: Large capacity bags with reinforced handles

Eco-Friendly Packaging Canada: Sustainability Benefits

Choosing paper bags wholesale Canada supports environmental goals:

  • 100% Biodegradable: Decomposes in 2-6 weeks in composting conditions
  • Recyclable: Can be recycled up to 7 times
  • Renewable Materials: Made from sustainably managed forests
  • Lower Carbon Footprint: 70% less CO2 emissions vs. plastic bags
  • No Microplastics: Doesn't contribute to ocean pollution

Wholesale Pricing: What to Expect

When ordering kraft paper bags bulk in Canada, pricing depends on:

  • Order Quantity: Minimum 10,000 units for custom printing
  • Customization Level: 1-color vs. full-color printing affects cost
  • Paper GSM: Heavier paper costs more but offers better durability
  • Handle Type: Twisted handles cost slightly more than flat handles
  • Size: Larger bags require more material

Typical Wholesale Pricing Ranges

  • 10,000 units: $0.25-$0.45 per bag
  • 25,000 units: $0.20-$0.35 per bag
  • 50,000+ units: $0.15-$0.28 per bag

Note: Prices vary based on specifications. Contact us for accurate quotes.

How to Order Custom Paper Bags Toronto

Our streamlined ordering process for branded shopping bags:

  1. Request a Quote: Share your requirements (quantity, size, customization)
  2. Review Samples: We send physical samples for approval
  3. Approve Design: We create digital mockups of your custom design
  4. Production: 10-12 business days for manufacturing
  5. Quality Check: Every batch undergoes inspection
  6. Delivery: Nationwide shipping across Canada

Frequently Asked Questions

What's the minimum order for custom paper bags?

Our minimum order quantity is 10,000 units for custom printed paper bags wholesale Canada. We also offer generic bags in smaller quantities.

How long does production take?

Standard production time is 10-12 business days after design approval. Rush orders (6-8 days) are available for an additional fee.

Can I order samples before placing a bulk order?

Yes! We provide physical samples of paper stock, sizes, and handle types. Custom printed samples are available for a nominal fee.

Do you ship across all of Canada?

Absolutely. We ship eco-friendly packaging Canada to all provinces and territories, with warehousing in Toronto for faster GTA delivery.

Are your paper bags food-safe?

Yes, all our restaurant paper bags supplier products meet FDA food safety standards and Canadian regulations.

Ready to Order Paper Bags Wholesale Canada?

Whether you need custom paper bags Toronto, kraft paper bags bulk for your restaurant, or branded shopping bags for your retail business, PackAxis is your trusted supplier of recyclable paper bags and eco-friendly packaging Canada.

Contact us today for wholesale pricing, samples, and expert guidance on choosing the perfect paper bags for your Canadian business. Join thousands of restaurants and retailers across Toronto and Canada who trust PackAxis for quality, sustainability, and service.

Related Products:

  • Browse our complete paper bag collection
  • Frequently Asked Questions
  • More packaging industry insights
